verdict.summary: Attempting to create a tag that already exists.

dead_ends.why_fails: If already pushed, other clones still have the old tag pointing to the old commit
Changes tag for you locally but remote and others still have the old one

workarounds.action: Use a different tag name: v1.0.1 or v1.0.0-rc2
workarounds.how: Semantic versioning should increment, not reuse tags

workarounds.action: If you need to move the tag: git tag -d <tag> && git push origin :refs/tags/<tag> && git tag <tag> && git push origin <tag>
workarounds.how: Deletes locally and remotely, then recreates â€” communicate to team

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'fatal' indicates a duplicate Git tag, while 'error' indicates uncommitted changes blocking a merge/pull.
'fatal' indicates a duplicate Git tag, while 'error' indicates a conflict during Git cherry-pick.
